Recommended readings to everyone who is interested about Economics, Mathematics, Data Science and Geoeconomics.

# Economics

## Microeconomics

1.  Kreps, D. (2013). Microeconomic Foundations I: Choice and Competitive Markets. Princeton University Press.

2.  Kreps, D. (2023). Microeconomic Foundations II: Imperfect Competition, Information, and Strategic Interaction. Princeton University Press.

3. Cameron, A. and Trivedi, P. (2005) Microeconometrics: Methods and Applications. Cambridge University Press, New York.

4.  Mas-Colell, A., Whinston, M., and Green, J. (1995). Microeconomic Theory. New York: Oxford University Press.

## Econometrics

1.  Wooldridge, J. (2019) Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach. Cengage Learning

2.  Wooldridge, J. (2010) Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data. MIT press

3.  Angrist, J. and Pischke, J. (2009) Mostly Harmless Econometrics: An Empiricist's Companion. Princeton University Press

## Geoeconomics

1.  Lovelace, R., Nowosad, J., and Muenchow, J. (2019). [Geocomputation with R](https://r.geocompx.org/index.html). CRC Press.

2.  Comber, L., and Brunsdon, C. (2020). Geographical Data Science and Spatial Data Analysis: An Introduction in R. Sage.

3.  Kopczewska, K. (2020). Applied Spatial Statistics and Econometrics: Data Analysis in R. Routledge.

## Experimental economics

1.  Friedman, D. (1994) Experimental Methods: A Primer for Economists. Cambridge University Press

2.  Gibbons, R. (1992) Game Theory for Applied Economists. Princeton University Press

# Data science

## R for Economics

1.  Wickham, H., and Grolemund, G. (2016). [R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html). O'Reilly Media, Inc.

2.  Llaudet, E., and Imai, K. (2022). Data Analysis for Social Science: A Friendly and Practical Introduction. Princeton University Press.

3.  Imai, K. (2017) Quantitative Social Science: An Introduction. Princeton University Press

4.  Wickham, H., Navarro, D., and Pedersen, T. (2023) [ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis (3e)](https://ggplot2-book.org/).

## Python for Economics

1.  Heiss, F. (2016). [Using R for Introductory Econometrics](http://www.urfie.net/?fbclid=IwAR0Iax1Am67ZTTUmaCf_zE7ObMVrcAZ-2hEsuJMErMCyi3qvlQ4WC9wttbI). DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany: Florian Heiss.

2. McKinney, W. (2022). [Python for data analysis: Data wrangling with Pandas. NumPy, and Jupyter](https://wesmckinney.com/book/).

# Statistics

1. Wonnacott, T., Wonnacott, R. (2010) Introductory statistics (5th Edition). Wiley

# Mathematics

## Linear algebra

1.  Lay, D. (2022). Linear algebra and its applications. Pearson Education Limited.

## Vector calculus

1.  Marsden, J. and Tromba, A. (2012). Vector calculus. Macmillan.

2.  Thomas, G., Finney, R., Weir, M., and Giordano, F. (2018). Thomas' calculus. Reading: Addison-Wesley.

## Mathematical statistics

1.  Rice, J. (2013) Mathematical Statistics and Data Analysis. Cengage learning
